title: American_Top_40_1982_August_21st
description:
"Now as we continue our countdown of the forty biggest hits in the country I'd like to welcome five new stations to the American Top 40 family. There's KLER in Orofino, Idaho, KLTZ in Glasgow, Montana, KGEL in Dallas Texas, KORT in Grangeville, Idaho, and KUJ in Walla Walla, Washington. Glad to have you with us. My name's Casey Kasem and we're counting down the biggest hits in the country."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Acts hitting the top 40 for the first time include Billy Idol, Men At Work, and Marshall Crenshaw.

Casey tells us whatever became of Hank Ballard, the man who wrote and originally charted with "The Twist."

There are songs from the motion pictures "Rocky III," "Fast Times at Ridgemont High," "Six Pack," and the hit musical, "Dream Girls."

A listener wants to know, "What number has appeared most frequently in the names of groups who hit the top 40?" (Such as 3 in "Three Dog Night," or 5 in "The Jackson Five.)

One man in the countdown got his start when a record producer fired his original studio singer saying, "I can get anyone off the street to sing better than you!" The man he got off the street is in the countdown.

LW#3: Abracadabra - Steve Miller Band
LW#2: Hurts So Good - John Cougar
